Summary: Not sure what I saw. Took me so off guard. Especially after hearing about something similar in montreal only 2 days ago.
divs: Sighting DetailsI had just finished work at 1930 and was headed to the hockey arena to pick up my oldest daughter and my son . My thoughts were busy from the day's events and what I still had to do before going to bed. I pulled into the parking lot and sent my husband a text to let him know I was there and to send the kids out as he was staying with our other daughter at the rink. I was watching for my kids and when they came out I noted that my 2 year old son was without a hat. I looked up to see the temperature gage to check the outside temp when in the corner of my eye I saw what I thought was a shooting star. I expected it to disappear but as it got closer it got larger and slower than a shooting star. When I was staring at it straight on I could see a blue ball the size of the harvest moon. It was bright and glowing. Blue to lighter blue then surrounded by white light. As it was exiting my field of vision I could see what I thought maybe a trail or tail. I am not sure about that. But in front of the ball the sky was brighter than behind it. The object then disappeared over the tree tops. I heard no noise. I looked around my daughter was buckling my son in his car seat and there wasn't another person in the parking lot. I am convinced someone else in the city had to have seen it. The object was too large for only me to have seen it. At that moment I felt like this experience was to extraordinary to not be shared.
